title: New checks at Queensland airports
body: Queensland police will have new airport checks to keep coronavirus at bay as hundreds more international arrivals and Canberrans flock to the state as border restrictions ease with the ACT.

title: Protesters arrested as police crack down on anti-lockdown rally
body: Anti-lockdown protests have taken place in Melbourne for the third weekend in a row, despite warnings from police and health authorities to stay at home.

title: Households focus of concern as Victoria's case numbers dive
body: Victoria has recorded a significant drop in the number of new coronavirus infections with 21 new cases identified in the last 24 hours.

title: House party costs guests $28k for breaching COVID-19 restrictions
body: Police have issued 28 fines, each worth $1000, for a house party allegedly breaching the public Health Order in Sydney's east overnight.

title: Hospital worker among three new cases of COVID-19 in NSW
body: Three new cases of COVID-19 have been diagnosed in NSW in the last 24 hours, bringing the state's total number of cases to 4009.

title: Sydney CBD to be turned 'inside out' in response to the pandemic
body: Sydney's CBD laneways will transform this summer to help the city revitalise its struggling hospitality industry.

title: Emergency tents, restrictions back as virus spikes in Madrid
body: Many residents in Madrid will need a reason to leave their neighborhoods and will face limitations on group gatherings even stricter than the ones in place as authorities moved Friday to try to rein in Europe's fastest-spreading second coronavirus wave.

title: WA premier warns increased return flights could delay surgery
body: Western Australia Premier Mark McGowan has warned that the national plan to lift the cap on returning Aussies would cause hospital delays.

title: Warnings issues as South Australia prepares to open NSW border
body: South Australians have been warned to take extra health precautions as the state prepares to open its border with New South Wales.

title: New Years Eve fireworks could be called off in Sydney
body: Sydney's iconic New Years Eve fireworks could be cancelled with authorities nervous about the prospect of another pandemic outbreak.

title: Couple reunited with children after being stranded in Mexico
body: A pregnant Aussie couple stranded in Mexico have finally been reunited with their children after almost two months away.

title: Melbourne families at centre of major virus outbreak broke lockdown
body: Families who broke lockdown are at the centre of a major coronavirus outbreak in Melbourne's south-east, with 34 cases across five households detected.

title: Victoria records new milestone as virus cases spike
body: Victoria has recorded 45 new COVID-19 infections and a further five deaths as the state hits a grim new milestone of over 20,000 cases.

title: Thousands more Aussies able to return home
body: The PM says states have agreed to increase international travel caps, with non-international airports in smaller states also allowed to take arrivals from overseas.

title: Poop knives, arachnophobic entomologists win 2020 Ig Nobels
body: Maybe this year's Ig Nobels, the spoof prizes for dubious but humorous scientific achievement, should have been renamed the Ick Nobels.

title: Cap on international arrivals to be lifted
body: More Australians will be allowed to return home with the federal government set to lift the cap on international arrival limits.

title: Get tested for coronavirus if you have been to these NSW venues
body: NSW Health authorities have released a list of venues that may be impacted by a coronavirus cluster.

title: Three countries account for half of global COVID-19 cases
body: Global coronavirus cases have surpassed 30 million as the World Health Organisation warned of "alarming rates of transmission" across Europe and cautioned nations against cutting quarantine periods.

title: Queensland to lift border restrictions for ACT residents next Friday
body: Queensland will lift border restrictions on the ACT from 1am next Friday, September 25.

title: Just one new locally acquired case in NSW
body: There have been no cases of coronavirus detected in NSW in the past 24 hours in residents out in the community.

title: American pastor sceptical of masks lands in the ICU for COVID-19
body: Earlier this year, Paul Van Noy told parishioners he didn't "want to be told" he needed to wear a mask.

title: Behind the data linking COVID-19 with diabetes
body: Cardiac disease and diabetes are among the top conditions present in patients presenting to ICU or dying from COVID-19, the latest data from Department of Health has revealed.

title: Indonesians caught without a mask forced to dig graves for COVID-19 victims
body: Though mask-wearing is mandatory in public throughout Indonesia, there has been a vocal segment of the population that has been reluctant to wear masks and practice social distancing.

title: Vaccine trial participant suffered inflamed spinal cord
body: A new report has revealed the disturbing side effects suffered by the 37-year-old woman which prompted AstraZeneca to pause its vaccine trial.

title: Huge delays at regional Victorian checkpoints ahead of weekend rush
body: It comes as checkpoints into regional Victoria face their first major test, with police vowing to stamp out unlawful actions.

title: Rules around JobSeeker changes to be tightened
body: More than 1 million Australians relying on the JobSeeker payment will soon need to look for more work while receiving the benefit, according to reports.

title: Regional Victoria's reopening giving Melbournians 'hope'
body: Melbourne mayor Sally Capp says once the city reopens, residents there will have a new appreciation for everything.

title: Prediction Queensland borders to reopen to NSW 'within weeks'
body: The issue is set to dominate National Cabinet today, where Annastacia Palaszczuk will speak hours after testing negative to coronavirus.

title: WHO warns of 'very serious situation' in Europe as virus cases spike
body: The World Health Organisation (WHO) has warned that coronavirus cases are surging alarmingly in Europe, as a "very serious situation" unfolds across the continent.

title: New UK restrictions as COVID-19 cases spike
body: Britain has imposed tougher restrictions on people and businesses in parts of northeastern England as the nation attempts to stem the spread of COVID-19 before the colder winter months.

title: Qld Health knew dead man did not have COVID-19 for days
body: Government emails reveal senior Queensland health officials knew a deceased Blackwater man repeatedly tested negative for COVID-19 - three days before they informed the town, and finally allowed his fiancée out of isolation.

title: Footy finals set for new crowds - but there are conditions
body: New South Wales will double its event crowd sizes for the footy finals, as 9News reported last night.

title: Victoria's authorities continue blame game over quarantine outbreak
body: Former Victoria Police chief commissioner Graham Ashton was today grilled by an inquiry into the system on his knowledge of the use of private security in quarantine hotels.

title: Breaking news and updates Australia: September 17, 2020
body: India's daily virus increase surges record; PM issues captain's call on international arrivals; Five new cases in NSW, one in Queensland; Victorian infections hit new low, eight deaths

title: As India's virus cases rise, so do questions over death toll
body: Experts say the numbers are misleading and that India is not counting many deaths.

title: Centenarian defeats COVID-19 in remarkable recovery
body: A Melbourne centenarian has headed home from hospital after recovering from COVID-19.

title: Calls for gymnastics and dance classes to return in regional Victoria
body: Two state-wide petitions have been launched by the dance and gymnastics industries calling for children's classes to return in regional Victoria.

title: Victoria records lowest daily COVID-19 figures in over two months
body: Victoria has recorded its lowest COVID-19 figures in more than two months, with 28 new infections and eight further deaths.

title: Mexico City's coronavirus deaths 'almost double' official toll
body: Mexico City suffered 20,535 'excess deaths' attributable to COVID-19 between April and August, almost double the number reported in the official death toll of 11,318, according to a city official.

title: Queensland accuses PM of 'rejecting health advice' on 28-day border rule
body: Queensland's Health Minister Steven Miles says Prime Minister Scott Morrison "rejected health advice" which supports the northern state's 28-day trigger point for reopening the border to New South Wales.

title: Four-year-old kindergarten to be free in Victoria for Term 4
body: Four-year-old kindergarten will be free in Victoria for Term 4 under a mass $26.7 million support package announced today.

title: Melbourne's lockdown longer than Wuhan
body: Melbourne's lockdown has surpassed the original length of Wuhan's as a bulk of suburbs in the city's north and west mark their 78th day of isolation.

title: Face masks may be 'more effective than COVID-19 vaccine'
body: Director of the Federal Centres for Disease Control and Prevention Robert Redfield earlier told a public hearing a COVID-19 vaccine would not be rolled out before the middle of next year or later.

title: Super spreader wedding linked to deaths of seven people who didn't attend
body: A rural church wedding and reception on a beautiful day in the US state of Maine was no doubt a happy day. But it has spread misery ever since.

title: Prime Minister will 'follow the rules' on Queensland border closures
body: Scott Morrison is blocked from entering Queensland ahead of the election unless he spends 14 days in mandatory quarantine.

title: NSW eases restrictions for border communities
body: Major changes to make life easier for residents in border towns.

title: Coronavirus restrictions easing for south-east Queensland
body: Parts of south-east Queensland will be given more freedom today, with the state recording four straight days with no new COVID-19 cases.

title: Regional Victorians wake to freedoms, Melburnians face fines
body: Attempting to cross into regional Victoria is this morning three times more expensive, with new checkpoints in place and additional police patrolling freeways.

title: US releases virus vaccine 'playbook'
body: US health agencies sketched out plans for a vaccination campaign to begin gradually in January or possibly later this year, eventually ramping up to reach any American who wants a shot.

title: 'Heartbroken': Stranded Aussies plead for increased flights
body: The political stoush over bringing stranded Australians home is hurting citizens overseas.
